Claim: A claim that India’s Ministry of Home Affairs has made it a “punishable offense” for citizens to publish posts on social media about the novel coronavirus has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp.
Explaination: The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said it had made no such law; an online search for the purported government minister who issued the alleged ban yielded no results.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that India’s Ministry of Home Affairs has made it a “punishable offense” for citizens to publish posts on social media about the novel coronavirus has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp.

Explanation:The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said it had made no such law; an online search for the purported government minister who issued the alleged ban yielded no results.

https://factcheck.afp.com/hoax-circulates-india-government-has-banned-coronavirus-related-posts-social-media

Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A photo of a Sri Lankan military hospital has been shared thousands of times in multiple Facebook posts alongside a claim that it has been reserved exclusively for the use of “VIPs” who test positive for COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; Sri Lankan military and hospital authorities told AFP that the military hospital and the country's other medical facilities are being prepared for all COVID-19 patients.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-medical-facilities-hospital-will-remain-open-all-covid-19-patients?check=1

Claim: The Gandhi siblings- Priyanka and Rahul broke down the lockdown enforced in India and were roaming around.
Explaination: This video is from 2019 when the siblings had visited Meerut to meet the anti-CAA protestors.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: The Gandhi siblings- Priyanka and Rahul broke down the lockdown enforced in India and were roaming around.

Explanation:This video is from 2019 when the siblings had visited Meerut to meet the anti-CAA protestors.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/dated-clip-falsely-shared-as-gandhis-violating-lockdown-7563

Claim: Bitter gourd juice can cure novel coronavirus, as per Bihar Health Department in India.
Explaination: The post claiming bitter gourd can cure novel coronavirus in 2 hours is fake. Bihar Health Department has not issued any such statement.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Bitter gourd juice can cure novel coronavirus, as per Bihar Health Department in India.

Explanation:The post claiming bitter gourd can cure novel coronavirus in 2 hours is fake. Bihar Health Department has not issued any such statement.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-bitter-guard-juice-cannot-cure-novel-coronavirus-health-experts-refute-the-viral-claim/

Claim: Employer covered up part of a poster on virus prevention that advised people to stay home when sick.
Explaination: The part that was covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Employer covered up part of a poster on virus prevention that advised people to stay home when sick.

Explanation:The part that was covered up on the poster advises people to avoid large gatherings.

https://factcheck.afp.com/employer-did-not-hide-advice-skip-work-covid-19-poster

Claim: Biden campaign claims a top CDC official was “silenced.”
Explaination: Messonnier’s remarks on Feb. 25 may have caught the attention of Wall Street and caused angst in the White House. But we cannot find evidence of her being immediately silenced, as Klain claims in the video.
Label: Four Pinocchios
html:
Claim: Biden campaign claims a top CDC official was “silenced.”

Explanation:Messonnier’s remarks on Feb. 25 may have caught the attention of Wall Street and caused angst in the White House. But we cannot find evidence of her being immediately silenced, as Klain claims in the video.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/03/24/biden-campaigns-false-claim-top-cdc-official-was-silenced/

Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.
Explaination: Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Infected taxi driver demands money from his government otherwise he’ll infect others.

Explanation:Story originated from a parody account, no driver is threatneing to spread covid-19 across Nigeria.

https://factcheck.afp.com/story-originated-parody-account-no-driver-threatening-spread-covid-19-across-nigeria

Claim: Coronavirus spreads in Ecuadorian cities (Quito – Guayaquil).
Explaination: The Ministry of Public Health analyzes a suspicious case. There is no confirmation about the presence of the virus in Ecuador.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus spreads in Ecuadorian cities (Quito – Guayaquil).

Explanation:The Ministry of Public Health analyzes a suspicious case. There is no confirmation about the presence of the virus in Ecuador.

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/2020/01/27/coronavirus-ecuador-ministerio-caso-pandemia/

Claim: Silver Solution used on strains of coronavirus “totally eliminates it. Kills it. Deactivates it.”
Explaination: There are no pills or remedies that cure any strain of human coronavirus including COVID-19. In fact, Sellman’s "silver solution," and colloidal silver, can hurt you, and not just your wallet.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Silver Solution used on strains of coronavirus “totally eliminates it. Kills it. Deactivates it.”

Explanation:There are no pills or remedies that cure any strain of human coronavirus including COVID-19. In fact, Sellman’s "silver solution," and colloidal silver, can hurt you, and not just your wallet.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/17/sherill-sellman/no-silver-solution-wont-cure-coronavirus/

Claim: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of COVID-19 in one day on 3/23/20.
Explaination: Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of people in medical scrubs lying on the floor of an operating theatre shows some of the 200 Italian doctors who died of COVID-19 in one day on 3/23/20.

Explanation:Photo is a still from an episode of US TV drama, Grey's Anatomy. And there is no evidence to show that 200 Italian doctors died on 23 March 2020.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/photo-not-of-italian-doctors-dead-from-covid-19-its-from-tv-drama-greys-anatomy/

Claim: President Donald Trump “will evoke (sic) what is called the Stafford act” and “order a two week mandatory quarantine for the nation.”
Explaination: There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said March 16 that he was not considering it. The Stafford Act authorizes aid to state and local governments and is commonly used during hurricanes. It does not mandate a nationwide lockdown.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump “will evoke (sic) what is called the Stafford act” and “order a two week mandatory quarantine for the nation.”

Explanation:There is no evidence that the federal government is set to announce a nationwide lockdown. President Trump said March 16 that he was not considering it. The Stafford Act authorizes aid to state and local governments and is commonly used during hurricanes. It does not mandate a nationwide lockdown.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/17/facebook-posts/social-posts-are-misinterpreting-federal-disaster-/

Claim: Vitamin C stops or slows novel coronavirus.
Explaination: There is, to date, no known cure for coronavirus. Medical professionals and researchers also said there was no conclusive evidence to suggest Vitamin C can treat or prevent coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Vitamin C stops or slows novel coronavirus.

Explanation:There is, to date, no known cure for coronavirus. Medical professionals and researchers also said there was no conclusive evidence to suggest Vitamin C can treat or prevent coronavirus.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471615-Fake-News-Vitamin-C-Does-NOT-Slow-Or-Stop-Coronavirus.html

Claim: A new vaccine to cure coronavirus has been developed by U.S. scientists.
Explaination: No, the image in the viral post isn’t a coronavirus vaccine. It is a COVID-19 test kit.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A new vaccine to cure coronavirus has been developed by U.S. scientists.

Explanation:No, the image in the viral post isn’t a coronavirus vaccine. It is a COVID-19 test kit.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-this-isnt-a-coronavirus-vaccine-this-is-a-covid-19-test-kit/

Claim: The common cold is the only type of coronavirus.
Explaination: Coronaviruses can cause different illnesses in animals and humans, including the common cold. However, they can also lead to severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The common cold is the only type of coronavirus.

Explanation:Coronaviruses can cause different illnesses in animals and humans, including the common cold. However, they can also lead to severe diseases such as Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS).

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471826-fact-check-common-cold-is-not-the-only-type-of-coronavirus.html

Claim: Coronil drops can help cure coronavirus.
Explaination: Leading homeopaths say that very little is known about the composition of this medicine and it will be careless to recommend this medicine for coronavirus
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Coronil drops can help cure coronavirus.

Explanation:Leading homeopaths say that very little is known about the composition of this medicine and it will be careless to recommend this medicine for coronavirus

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/no-proof-to-suggest-coronil-drops-cure-coronavirus-covid-19

Claim: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.
Explaination: The video is actually of Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on February 7 after getting infected.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.

Explanation:The video is actually of Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on February 7 after getting infected.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/video-of-wuhan-residents-mourning-doctors-death-shared-with-false-claims-6834

Claim: Japan has sent a 1,000-man medical team to Wuhan.
Explaination: The image circulating on social media is over 11 years old, taken on May 20, 2008, of a 22-member medical team at Japan’s Narita International Airport before flying to Chengdu city in China, then been hit by an earthquake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Japan has sent a 1,000-man medical team to Wuhan.

Explanation:The image circulating on social media is over 11 years old, taken on May 20, 2008, of a 22-member medical team at Japan’s Narita International Airport before flying to Chengdu city in China, then been hit by an earthquake.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-photo-1000-japanese-medical-volunteers

Claim: A video caption said: “Doctor affected by the virus in a hospital in Wuhan, China.”
Explaination: Prior instances of the video had captions, confirmed by media reports, said the video showed a doctor collapsing in Yunnan province because of overwork and hypoglycemia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video caption said: “Doctor affected by the virus in a hospital in Wuhan, China.”

Explanation:Prior instances of the video had captions, confirmed by media reports, said the video showed a doctor collapsing in Yunnan province because of overwork and hypoglycemia.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200204-chine-medecin-coronavirus-hopital-wuhan-yunnan

Claim: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.
Explaination: The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: A graphic has been shared in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim it contains a quote from Philippine Vice President Leni Robredo that bats are the “enemy” in the novel coronavirus pandemic. The graphic is attributed to Inquirer.net, a Philippine media outlet.

Explanation:The claim is false; the graphic has been doctored from an earlier Inquirer.net post in which Robredo was quoted about confusion surrounding the government’s response to the coronavirus outbreak.

https://factcheck.afp.com/graphic-purported-quote-philippine-vice-president-leni-robredo-has-been-doctored

Claim: The new coronavirus “causes sudden death syndrome.”
Explaination: There is no evidence that the virus causes sudden death syndrome.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The new coronavirus “causes sudden death syndrome.”

Explanation:There is no evidence that the virus causes sudden death syndrome.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/11/facebook-posts/no-evidence-coronavirus-causes-sudden-death-syndro/

Claim: Russia said COVID-19 is man-made.
Explaination: the Russian Ministry of Health said it did not make such a statement; the document cited in the misleading posts states COVID-19 is a “recombinant virus” which can form naturally.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Russia said COVID-19 is man-made.

Explanation:the Russian Ministry of Health said it did not make such a statement; the document cited in the misleading posts states COVID-19 is a “recombinant virus” which can form naturally.

https://factcheck.afp.com/russias-ministry-health-refutes-misleading-online-claim-it-stated-covid-19-man-made

Claim: If you don’t wear a mask while driving, police will fine you 200 baht.
Explaination: Police insisted that no such policy to fine people not wearing a mask.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If you don’t wear a mask while driving, police will fine you 200 baht.

Explanation:Police insisted that no such policy to fine people not wearing a mask.

https://www.facebook.com/SureAndShare/photos/a.266174050413176/1068951930135380/?check=2

Claim: Some Countries are dumping COVID-19 infected dead bodies in the sea, therefore be careful while consuming sea food.
Explaination: The original video was captured and published in 2014 when dozens of migrant bodies were washed ashore in Libya.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Some Countries are dumping COVID-19 infected dead bodies in the sea, therefore be careful while consuming sea food.

Explanation:The original video was captured and published in 2014 when dozens of migrant bodies were washed ashore in Libya.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/fact-check-these-are-not-deceased-covid19-victims-washed-ashore/

Claim: Video of police roughing up civilians claimed to be police in Spain enforcing a lockdown.
Explaination: The video is originally from Baku, Azerbaijan from a protest in October 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video of police roughing up civilians claimed to be police in Spain enforcing a lockdown.

Explanation:The video is originally from Baku, Azerbaijan from a protest in October 2019.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/video-from-azerbaijan-falsely-shared-as-spanish-police-enforcing-a-lockdown-7437

Claim: Graphics with information about COVID-19 containing UNICEF branding and inaccurate information.
Explaination: A series of infographics with Unicef branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Graphics with information about COVID-19 containing UNICEF branding and inaccurate information.

Explanation:A series of infographics with Unicef branding making claims about COVID-19 are not from the UN agency.

https://pesacheck.org/fake-these-infographics-about-covid-19-are-not-from-unicef-faa81719eba3?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4
